Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice with top of handle zone; creamy slip; interior: streaky glaze (fired brown); part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; red dot at top of sherd and trace of white band at bottom; exterior largely reserved; in handle zone, two brown lines and trace of metope pattern consisting of group of vertical strokes; at bottom of sherd dilute line and row a linked dots; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Lemos pl. 147, no. 1071 (from Marion in Cyprus).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0982) (phase 2)
